intro: Camellia thea, commonly known as the Chinese tea plant, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is an evergreen shrub that can grow up to 1–3 meters tall, with dark green, leathery leaves. The plant produces camellia flowers, which are typically pink or white, and are followed by oval, reddish-brown seeds. The leaves are used to make various types of tea, including green, black, and oolong tea. Camellia thea thrives in humid, subtropical climates and requires well-drained soil.
